text: James Catherwood Hormel (January 1, 1933 - August 13, 2021) was an American philanthropist, LGBT activist, and Democratic politician. He was the United States Ambassador to Luxembourg from 1999 to 2001 during the Bill Clinton presidency. Hormel was born in Austin, Minnesota. He was the first openly gay ambassador ever nominated in the United States. Hormel died on August 13, 2021 in San Francisco, California at the age of 88.Nation's first openly gay ambassador James Hormel dies ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States Category:Philanthropists from Minnesota Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:Businesspeople from Minnesota Category:Politicians from Minnesota Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:LGBT businesspeople Category:American LGBT politicians Category:Gay men Category:Politicians from San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco
title: James Hormel
